Descripción: Luna Roja es una investigación sobre los secuestros, torturas, asesinatos y desapariciones forzadas en Mar del Plata durante el Terrorismo de Estado ejercido por la última dictadura militar.
subject: Dictadura
source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives

Descripción: Radio program episode discusses man's quest for answers, then introduces Robinson and his concept of the Cosmic God-Power. Robinson discusses the God-Power, reads a student letter asking for help, and uses the discovery of the 'cosmic ray' by Professor Milikan as evidence that there is invisible power around us. Robinson claims this Power is for our use and can bring anyone what they desire. Also includes a testimonial from a man claimed to live in Holland.
subject: Spirit of God, God-Power;  Cosmic Rays; Science and Technology; Student Letters; Hardship; Material Abundance; Testimonials

Título: Good News - Purpose of the Program
Descripción: Radio program episode outlines the purpose of the 'Good News' radio program, to broadcast positive and peaceful things rather than negative. Episode includes organ music and songs sung by Al Marino, jokes made in the face of war, and urges listeners to buy quality-made products for better piece of mind.
subject: Peace; Good News; Quality Products; World War; Organ
